TEI.2.document_title: Ireston C. Devan to Stephen F. Austin, 02-24-1826

barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1267

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*Wants clerical employment.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Mississippi State*/location_mentioned**/p* *p**location_mentioned*Monroe County*/location_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*Mr Stephen F. Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*I had the pleasure to receive a letter of you or your *person_mentioned*agent */person_mentioned*dated at *location_mentioned*herculanium */location_mentioned*respecting the situation of the *location_mentioned*Lands you had procured of the *person_mentioned*Mexican Government*/person_mentioned**/location_mentioned* which afforded me infinite satisfaction tho I am not acquainted with your person I am with your Character I want you to procure me a *location_mentioned*Birth in some office*/location_mentioned* as a *person_mentioned*Clerk */person_mentioned*and I will be in that *location_mentioned*Country*/location_mentioned* immediately after I secure an answer from you you will confer a lasting favour on your friend, by complying with this request you will please Direct to me at the place above named *date_mentioned n="02-24-1826">Feby. 24th 1826*/date_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Ireton C. Devan*/person_mentioned**/p* *p*To *person_mentioned*Stephen F Austin*/person_mentioned**/p* */div1*
